body.p: The small town of Palabro seems like an unlikely place for a high-class culinary establishment, but the Red Apple Inn's Chef Alex Choperoni is earning a national reputation for innovative dishes. And rightly so, if this reviewer's recent culinary experience is any example.

Within striking distance from the ski slopes at Jackson Hole, the Red Apple Inn is a completely restored Victorian hotel, and offers a warm and elegant atmosphere and gracious service. The upscale clientele includes regular appearances by movie stars Drew Barrymore and Matthew Broderick. Reservations are a must, and during the ski season it is not uncommon for the dining room to be booked solid six weeks in advance.

It is hard to go wrong with a menu this packed with interesting choices. The crab cakes are especially fine with a thin crisp crust that opens with a gentle prod of a fork to reveal a light, moist, almost mousse-like interior with a rich nutty flavor.
The Red Apple Inn boasts one of the finest wine cellars in the region. None of the dishes we sampled were less than outstanding. Here are a few of the selections from the daily menu.
